trans-unit.source: Equivalent Azure CLI commands for VM tasks | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Equivalent Azure CLI commands for VM tasks | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Equivalent Azure CLI commands to create and manage Azure VMs in Azure Resource Manager and Azure Service Management modes
trans-unit.target: Equivalent Azure CLI commands to create and manage Azure VMs in Azure Resource Manager and Azure Service Management modes

trans-unit.source: Equivalent Resource Manager and Service Management commands for VM tasks with the Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows
trans-unit.target: Equivalent Resource Manager and Service Management commands for VM tasks with the Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows

trans-unit.source: This article shows equivalent Microsoft Azure command-line interface (Azure CLI) commands to create and manage Azure VMs in Azure Service Management and Azure Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: This article shows equivalent Microsoft Azure command-line interface (Azure CLI) commands to create and manage Azure VMs in Azure Service Management and Azure Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: Use this as a handy guide to migrate scripts from one command mode to the other.
trans-unit.target: Use this as a handy guide to migrate scripts from one command mode to the other.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already installed the Azure CLI and connected to your subscription, see [Install the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-install.md) and [Connect to an Azure subscription from the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-connect.md).
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already installed the Azure CLI and connected to your subscription, see [Install the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-install.md) and [Connect to an Azure subscription from the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-connect.md).

trans-unit.source: When you want to use the Resource Manager mode commands, be sure to connect with the login method.
trans-unit.target: When you want to use the Resource Manager mode commands, be sure to connect with the login method.

trans-unit.source: To get started with the Resource Manager mode in the Azure CLI and switch command modes, see [Using the Azure Command-Line Interface with the Resource Manager](xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md).
trans-unit.target: To get started with the Resource Manager mode in the Azure CLI and switch command modes, see [Using the Azure Command-Line Interface with the Resource Manager](xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md).

trans-unit.source: By default the CLI starts in Service Management mode.
trans-unit.target: By default the CLI starts in Service Management mode.

trans-unit.source: To change to Resource Manager mode, run `azure config mode arm`.
trans-unit.target: To change to Resource Manager mode, run `azure config mode arm`.

trans-unit.source: To go back to Service Management mode, run `azure config mode asm`.
trans-unit.target: To go back to Service Management mode, run `azure config mode asm`.

trans-unit.source: For online command help and options, type `azure <command> <subcommand> --help` or `azure help <command> <subcommand>`.
trans-unit.target: For online command help and options, type `azure <command> <subcommand> --help` or `azure help <command> <subcommand>`.

trans-unit.source: The next table compares common VM tasks you can perform with Azure CLI commands in Service Management and Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: The next table compares common VM tasks you can perform with Azure CLI commands in Service Management and Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: With many Resource Manager commands you need to pass the name of an existing resource group.
trans-unit.target: With many Resource Manager commands you need to pass the name of an existing resource group.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] These examples don't include template-based operations in Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] These examples don't include template-based operations in Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: For information, see [Using the Azure Command-Line Interface with the Resource Manager](xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md).
trans-unit.target: For information, see [Using the Azure Command-Line Interface with the Resource Manager](xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md).

trans-unit.source: (Obtain the `image-urn` from the `azure vm image list` command.)
trans-unit.target: (Obtain the `image-urn` from the `azure vm image list` command.)

trans-unit.source: Create a VM from a user image
trans-unit.target: Create a VM from a user image

trans-unit.source: Create a VM from a specialized disk
trans-unit.target: Create a VM from a specialized disk

trans-unit.source: Add a data disk to a VM
trans-unit.target: Add a data disk to a VM

trans-unit.source: Remove a data disk from a VM
trans-unit.target: Remove a data disk from a VM

trans-unit.source: Add a generic extension to a VM
trans-unit.target: Add a generic extension to a VM

trans-unit.source: Add VM Access extension to a VM
trans-unit.target: Add VM Access extension to a VM

trans-unit.source: Add Docker extension to a VM
trans-unit.target: Add Docker extension to a VM

trans-unit.source: Add Chef extension to a VM
trans-unit.target: Add Chef extension to a VM

trans-unit.source: For more about using the Azure CLI to work with Resource Manager resources, see [Using the Azure Command-Line Interface with the Resource Manager](xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md) and [Managing Role-Based Access Control with the Azure Command-Line Interface](../role-based-access-control-xplat-cli.md).
trans-unit.target: For more about using the Azure CLI to work with Resource Manager resources, see [Using the Azure Command-Line Interface with the Resource Manager](xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md) and [Managing Role-Based Access Control with the Azure Command-Line Interface](../role-based-access-control-xplat-cli.md).
